content.statement: vascular:venous:ven-004-venous-hypertension is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Venous that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding vascular:venous:ven-004-venous-hypertension helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of vascular:venous:ven-004-venous-hypertension include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of vascular:venous:ven-004-venous-hypertension.

presentation: Progressive skin changes starting with hemosiderin deposition (pigmentation)
Atrophie blanche (ivory white patches with telangiectasias)
diagnosis: Direct ambulatory venous pressure measurement (invasive gold standard)
Air plethysmography with venous filling index
Duplex ultrasound for reflux and obstruction localization
Venous Clinical Severity Score (VCSS) for quantification
treatment: Compression therapy (cornerstone - reduces tissue edema and supports muscle pump)
Deep venous reconstruction for obstruction (stenting, bypass)

definition.@value: The pathological state of persistently elevated venous pressure during ambulation, resulting from reflux, obstruction, or muscle pump failure, which initiates the inflammatory cascade leading to chronic venous disease manifestations.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Describe the pathophysiological cascade from venous hypertension to ulceration
Correlate ambulatory venous pressure levels with clinical severity
Identify the inflammatory mechanisms underlying skin changes
Apply treatment strategies targeting venous hypertension
clinical_pearls: AVP >80 mmHg virtually guarantees ulceration if untreated
The gaiter area is most affected due to maximal hydrostatic pressure
Compression works by reducing tissue edema and improving muscle pump efficiency
Fibrin cuff theory explains impaired oxygen diffusion in venous disease
Leukocyte trapping and activation is the key inflammatory trigger

medicalCode.description: Varicose veins of unspecified lower extremity with inflammation
